    • Method Detail

      • addGallery

        public void addGallery(java.lang.String galleryName)
        Description copied from interface: GalleryManager
        Causes binding to a given gallery by creating appropriate objects which help to manage the data about the gallery with the supplied name. Gallery will be created with a default HtmlGenerator, so this will effectively be a default gallery style. Error Handling Main Cases - No folder with the given galleryName: Not a fatal error - just means we can't create this gallery and no images will appear on the associated page. All we can do is fall through and not do anything but make sure that later on we don't get fatal error when gallery not present. - I/O Errors (e.g. read error reading files). Treat like no folder present.
        Specified by:
        addGallery in interface GalleryManager
        Parameters:
        galleryName - The name of the gallery which defines the folder where the images are stored.

      • addGallery

        public void addGallery(java.lang.String galleryName,
              GalleryHtmlGenerator htmlGenerator)
        Description copied from interface: GalleryManager
        Causes binding to a given gallery by creating appropriate objects which help to manage the data about the gallery with the supplied name. Also takes supplied HtmlGenerator object and provides to Gallery so can alter the gallery style from the default.
        Specified by:
        addGallery in interface GalleryManager
        Parameters:
        galleryName - The name of the gallery which defines the folder where the images are stored.
        htmlGenerator - The object to use to generate the HTML for the page Error Handling Main Cases See addGallery(galleryName) for common errors. See below for errors relating to htmlGenerator - htmlGenerator is null : Can't create gallery as no way of generating HTML. Could use default Html generator but this could make things worse (Html may not match the JSP and cause more errors). Better to have no gallery. Throw Null Pointer Exception.

      • getGallery

        public Gallery getGallery(java.lang.String galleryName)
        Description copied from interface: GalleryManager
        Returns the Gallery object which is being used to manage a gallery with the supplied name.
        Specified by:
        getGallery in interface GalleryManager
        Parameters:
        galleryName - The name of the gallery which defines the folder where the images are stored.
        Returns:

      • removeGallery

        public void removeGallery(java.lang.String galleryName)
        Description copied from interface: GalleryManager
        Unbinds a gallery from the objects used to manage it, and removes these objects. Doesn't remove the actual folder or images from the folder. Also removes any thumbnail folders and files.
        Specified by:
        removeGallery in interface GalleryManager
        Parameters:
        galleryName - The name of the gallery which defines the folder where the images are stored.

      • isGalleryExist

        public boolean isGalleryExist(java.lang.String galleryName)
        Specified by:
        isGalleryExist in interface GalleryManager

      • regenerateAllGalleries

        public void regenerateAllGalleries()
        Description copied from interface: GalleryManager
        Iterates through all the galleries and re-creates them all. Used as a safe way of ensuring that all the galleries have up to date thumbnails and HTML etc.
        Specified by:
        regenerateAllGalleries in interface GalleryManager

      • getNumGalleries

        public int getNumGalleries()
        Specified by:
        getNumGalleries in interface GalleryManager
